name: Carolina Buddhist Vihara
address: Greenville, SC (Specific street address not publicly available, but they offer services and classes.)
description: A residence for Buddhist Nuns (Bhikkhuni order) offering teachings of the Buddha, primarily by bringing Theravada Buddhist nuns and monks to Greenville. They offer weekly meditation classes and sutta study

name: Spartanburg Buddhist Center of SC
description: Founded in 2010 by Cambodian-American Buddhists, this center incorporates Theravada Buddhist traditions. They offer daily chanting and meditation, as well as lessons on Southeast Asian culture and discussions

name: South Carolina Dharma Group
address: Dharma Center, Columbia, SC (Specific street address for the Dharma Center not explicitly stated, but they hold in-person meditation.)
description: A center for the study and practice of Tibetan Buddhism in the Gelugpa tradition. They offer in-person and online meditation sessions, teachings, and discussions

name: Kadampa Meditation Center South Carolina
address: Irmo, SC (Specific street address not publicly available.)
description: Offers programs and meditation courses for everyone, based on Kadampa Buddhism

name: Indigo Sangha
address: Charleston, SC (Specific street address not publicly available, but they are the greater-Charleston mindfulness practice center.)
description: A mindfulness practice center in the Plum Village Community of Engaged Buddhism, founded by Thich Nhat Hanh. They focus on mindfulness practice and engaged Buddhism
